item.description:
During the weekend of February 16-18, the Portland Green Streets program will be hosting a group of several families of transportational cyclists from the Boston area, who started the original Green Streets program there. We have arranged to meet them on Monday, February 18th, for a ride around Peaks Island, where they are staying (weather permitting), followed by a potluck dinner. If you don't have your bike out this time of year, or the weather does not permit a ride, please come anyway! There will be a beach stroll for the non-riders, and everyone's welcome at the pot-luck.

Here's the itinerary:

  • 2 PM: Portland contingent meets (with bikes, if you have them) at Casco Bay Ferry Lines
  • 2:15 PM: Ferry departs for Peaks Island
  • 3 PM: Meet Boston Green-Streeters at top of ferry road (probably have opportunity to drop off your potluck offering somewhere first). Bike ride departs. Non-riders depart for ocean-side stroll.
  • 4 PM or whenever riders/walkers return: Potluck dinner at the Inn at Peaks Island, 33 Island Ave, near the top of the ferry road.


Ferries back to Portland leave at 5:00, 6:00, 7:40, 8:40 or 9:40 PM. Round-trip fares are $3.75 for adults and children 10 and above, $1.85 for children 5-9, children under 5 are free, and bikes are $6. You will pay your own ferry fee, but there is no other charge for this meetup, though we do ask that you bring a potluck offering of some sort if possible. Also please bring your own plate(s), cup(s), napkin(s) and utensils.

Note changes from original plans: None of the group will be arriving on Monday as originally thought, and we were not able to arrange a demo of Metro bike racks for that day, so that demo and that of the train station bike racks will be postponed for another day, possibly later this month.
item.why: Ride the Peaks Island loop, and eat good food with interesting bike-y people.
item.name: Green Streets Party
